The explorers climbed a mound to survey the land around them.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Baseball)(of a pitcher) have a turn at pitching

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (as a verb in the sense 'enclose with a fence or hedge'): of obscure origin. An early sense of the noun was 'boundary hedge or fence'
Middle English (denoting the world): from Old French monde, from Latin mundus 'world'

entry.def: A mound of  something is a large rounded pile of it.

example.ex: The bulldozers piled up huge mounds of dirt...
example.tran: 推土机堆起一堆一堆的泥土。

example.ex: The table was a mound of paper and books.

entry.tran: (棒球内场中央高出地面的)投球区土墩
entry.def: In baseball, the mound is the raised area where the pitcher stands when he or she throws the ball.

means.word_mean: 1. (baseball) the slight elevation on which the pitcher stands
3. a collection of objects laid on top of each other
4. structure consisting of an artificial heap or bank usually of earth or stones;

sentences.sentence: "they built small mounds to hide behind"

means.word_mean: 5. the position on a baseball team of the player who throws the ball for a batter to try to hit;

sentences.sentence: "he has played every position except pitcher"
"they have a southpaw on the mound"

sentences.en: The explorers climbed a mound to survey the land around them.
sentences.cn: 勘探者爬上土丘去勘测周围的土地。

sentences.en: There is a mound of papers on my desk.
sentences.cn: 在我的办公桌上有一大堆文件。

sentences.en: And the golden mound of sweet oily ivory meat mounts in the milk glass bowl.
sentences.cn: 那香甜油亮的象牙般的核桃肉便在牛奶玻璃碗里堆成了金灿灿的小山。

jushi.english: We had mounds of tasteless rice.
jushi.chinese: 我们有成堆成堆的淡而无味的米饭。

jushi.english: He found himself beside a burial mound next morning when he woke up.
jushi.chinese: 第二天早晨醒来时他发现自己躺在一个坟堆边。
